revised_title: Dynamical Theory of Electron Diffraction: Applications to RHEED from Relaxed and Reconstructed Surfaces
tldr: The authors develop a general matrix representation of the dynamical theory of electron diffraction and apply it to reflectance high-energy electron diffraction (RHEED) from relaxed and reconstructed surfaces. They consider various scenarios, including reflection from crystal slabs and semi-infinite bulk crystals, and discuss the effects of surface relaxation and reconstruction on the resulting diffraction patterns.
